device_name: Digital Pathology Viewer and AI Analysis Software
intended_use: PathSight AI is intended to digitize, store, manage, and display whole-slide pathology images and to provide AI-assisted identification of regions of interest (ROIs) for review by a qualified pathologist. The software is not intended to replace pathologist interpretation and is intended as a decision-support tool only.
device_description: PathSight AI is a Software as a Medical Device (SaMD) that runs on validated hardware workstations (Windows 10/11, 64-bit, ≥32 GB RAM). The software includes: (1) a DICOM-compliant whole-slide image (WSI) viewer with pan/zoom/annotation tools; (2) a cloud-based AI inference engine (U-Net architecture, trained on 50,000 de-identified slides) that highlights ROIs for hematoxylin-eosin (H&E) stained tissue; (3) a case management module for pathologist workflow integration; and (4) an audit trail module for 21 CFR Part 11 compliance. The AI model outputs probability heat maps overlaid on the slide image; final diagnostic interpretation remains with the reviewing pathologist.

extracted_sections.device_description: PathSight AI is a SaMD running on validated workstations...

extracted_sections.software: Software lifecycle per IEC 62304:2006+AMD1:2015. Safety class B. Cybersecurity per FDA 2023 guidance.
extracted_sections.performance_testing: Clinical validation on 500-slide independent test set. Sensitivity 94.2%, specificity 97.1% for ROI detection vs. pathologist consensus.
